messages.title: A strong voice for Northampton North
messages.content: Michael won extra money from the Government to remove potholes and resurface roads in Northampton North. He secured £3.32 million to improve some of the worst roads in our town.

messages.title: Michael Fights to Improve Roads
messages.content: Several years ago Michael asked residents in a survey what the biggest local issue they would like addressed was, and the answer was for a call for the state of our roads to improve.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Michael runs Job Fairs to ensure the local economy works for those who work hard & play by the rules. Employment is also up by more than a third since he was elected as MP in 2010.
Taxes have been cut for over 35,000 local people since 2010 thanks to our long term economic plan. Michael wants more tax cuts so people keep more of their hard-earned wages.
Michael secures extra Government funds to resurface roads and reduce potholes, with recent allocation of £3.32 million for road improvements in Northampton North.

issues.economy: Taxes have been cut for over 35,000 local people since 2010 thanks to our long term economic plan. Michael wants more tax cuts so people keep more of their hard-earned wages.

leaflet.personalStatement: Over the last five years I have worked hard to secure a better future for Northampton; I've supported tax cuts for over 35,000 hardworking people in Northampton North, taking 4,000 out of paying tax altogether.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured funding for local road improvement, organized job fairs, employment up by more than a third since his election.

images.caption: Michael Ellis with the Transport Secretary Patrick McLoughlin at a road resurfacing in Boothville.
Supporting our Communities: Michael opened the newly-refurbished Post Office in Kingsley Park Terrace.
The choice at the General Election.
Michael Ellis Securing Britain's future for Northampton North.
